paper_metadata.title: Performance and Noise predictions of the Joby eVTOL Propeller NFAC Wind Tunnel Test Using GPU-accelerated Large-Eddy Simulations
paper_metadata.journal: Proceedings of the Vertical Flight Society 81st Annual Forum and Technology Display

relevance_assessment.justification: The paper focuses on the performance and noise predictions of the Joby eVTOL propeller, which is directly relevant to eVTOL aircraft design and optimization. The use of large-eddy simulations for noise prediction is critical for understanding and mitigating noise in urban air mobility applications.

technology_nodes.name: GPU-Accelerated Large-Eddy Simulations
technology_nodes.description: Advanced computational method for simulating turbulent flows around eVTOL propellers

technology_nodes.name: Noise Prediction Using FW-H Formulation
technology_nodes.description: Method for predicting far-field noise from propeller operations using frequency-domain analysis

technology_nodes.name: Joby Aviation S4 Propeller
technology_nodes.description: Propeller design used in Joby eVTOL aircraft, analyzed for performance and noise characteristics

relationships.subject: tech_large_eddy_simulation
relationships.evidence: Large-eddy simulations provide critical flow data necessary for accurate noise predictions

relationships.subject: tech_joby_propeller
relationships.evidence: The Joby S4 propeller's performance and noise characteristics are evaluated using large-eddy simulations

relationships.subject: tech_noise_prediction
relationships.evidence: Accurate noise predictions help in designing quieter eVTOL operations, essential for urban environments

adoption_indicators: Focus on Joby Aviation, a leading eVTOL manufacturer
Use of advanced GPU-accelerated simulations indicates cutting-edge research
Potential for significant impact on noise reduction strategies in urban air mobility
No prior citations suggest novel contributions to the field
Presented at a prominent vertical flight society forum indicates relevance and interest
